00005 package Value::Formula;

00011 my $UNDEF = bless {}, "UNDEF"; # used for undefined points

00014 #
00015 #  Call Parser to make the new Formula
00016 #
00017 sub new {
00018   my $self = shift;
00019   my $f = $self->SUPER::new(@_);
00020   foreach my $id ('open','close') {$f->{$id} = $f->{tree}{$id}}
00021   return $f;
00022 }
00023 
00024 #
00025 #  Create a new Formula with no string
00026 #    (we'll fill in its tree by hand)
00027 #
00028 sub blank {shift->SUPER::new(@_)}
00029 
00030 #
00031 #  with() changes tree element as well
00032 #    as the formula itself.
00033 #
00034 sub with {
00035   my $self = shift; my %hash = @_;
00036   $self = $self->SUPER::with(@_);
00037   $self->{tree} = $self->{tree}->copy($self); # make a new copy pointing to the new equation.
00038   foreach my $id (keys(%hash)) {$self->{tree}{$id} = $hash{$id}}
00039   return $self;
00040 }

00046 sub length {(shift)->{tree}->typeRef->{length}}
00047 
00048 sub isZero {(shift)->{tree}{isZero}}
00049 sub isOne {(shift)->{tree}{isOne}}

00051 sub isSetOfReals {(shift)->{tree}->isSetOfReals}
00052 sub canBeInUnion {(shift)->{tree}->canBeInUnion}

00056 ############################################
00057 #
00058 #  Create a BOP from two operands
00059 #
00060 #  Get the context and variables from the left and right operands
00061 #    if they are formulas
00062 #  Make them into Value objects if they aren't already.
00063 #  Convert '+' to union for intervals or unions.
00064 #  Make a new BOP with the two operands.
00065 #  Record the variables.
00066 #  Evaluate the formula if it is constant.
00067 #
00068 sub bop {
00069   my $bop = shift;
00070   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrder(@_);
00071   my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00072   my $call = $self->context->{method}{$bop};
00073   my $formula = $self->blank($self->context);
00074   if (ref($r) eq $class || ref($r) eq $pkg) {
00075     $formula->{context} = $r->{context};
00076     $r = $r->{tree}->copy($formula);
00077   } else {
00078     $r = $self->new($r)->{tree}->copy($formula);
00079   }
00080   if (ref($l) eq $class || ref($l) eq $pkg) {
00081     $formula->{context} = $l->{context};
00082     $l = $l->{tree}->copy($formula);
00083   } else {
00084     $l = $self->new($l)->{tree}->copy($formula);
00085   }
00086   $bop = 'U' if $bop eq '+' &&
00087     ($l->type =~ m/Interval|Set|Union/ || $r->type =~ m/Interval|Set|Union/);
00088   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("BOP")->new($formula,$bop,$l,$r);
00089   $formula->{variables} = $formula->{tree}->getVariables;
00090   return $formula;
00091 }
00092 
00093 sub add   {bop('+',@_)}
00094 sub sub   {bop('-',@_)}
00095 sub mult  {bop('*',@_)}
00096 sub div   {bop('/',@_)}
00097 sub power {bop('**',@_)}
00098 sub cross {bop('><',@_)}

00100 #
00101 #  Make dot work for vector operands
00102 #
00103 sub _dot   {
00104   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00105   if ($l->promotePrecedence($r)) {return $r->_dot($l,!$flag)}
00106   return bop('.',@_) if ($l->type eq 'Vector' || $l->{isVector}) &&
00107      Value::isValue($r) && ($r->type eq 'Vector' || $r->{isVector});
00108   $l->SUPER::_dot($r,$flag);
00109 }
00110 
00111 sub pdot {'('.(shift->stringify).')'}

00113 #
00114 #  Call the Parser::Function call function
00115 #
00116 sub call {
00117   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00118   Parser::Function->call($name,$self);
00119 }

00122 #
00123 #  Form the negation of a formula
00124 #
00125 sub neg {
00126   my $self = shift;
00127   my $formula = $self->blank($self->context);
00128   $formula->{variables} = $self->{variables};
00129   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("UOP")->new($formula,'u-',$self->{tree}->copy($formula));
00130   return $formula;
00131 }

00135 #
00136 sub atan2 {
00137   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00138   Parser::Function->call('atan2',$l,$r);
00139 }

00153 ############################################
00154 #
00155 #  Compare two functions for equality
00156 #
00157 sub compare {
00158   my ($l,$r) = @_; my $self = $l;
00159   my $context = $self->context;
00160   $r = $context->Package("Formula")->new($context,$r) unless Value::isFormula($r);
00161   Value::Error("Formulas from different contexts can't be compared")
00162     unless $l->{context} == $r->{context};
00163 
00164   #
00165   #  Get the test points and evaluate the functions at those points
00166   #
00167   ##  FIXME: Check given points for consistency
00168   ##  FIXME: make arrays if only a single value is given
00169   ##  FIXME: insert additional values if vars in use in formula aren't all the vars in the context
00170   my $points  = $l->{test_points} || $l->createRandomPoints(undef,$l->{test_at});
00171   my $lvalues = $l->{test_values} || $l->createPointValues($points,1,1);
00172   my $rvalues = $r->createPointValues($points,0,1,$l->{checkUndefinedPoints});
00173   #
00174   # Note: $l is bigger if $r can't be evaluated at one of the points
00175   return 1 unless $rvalues;
00176 
00177   my ($i, $cmp);
00178 
00179   #
00180   #  Handle adaptive parameters:
00181   #    Get the tolerances, and check each adapted point relative
00182   #    to the ORIGINAL correct answer.  (This will have to be
00183   #    fixed if we ever do adaptive parameters for non-real formulas)
00184   #
00185   #  FIXME:  it doesn't make sense to apply the ORIGINAL value's
00186   #          tolerance, and causes problems when the values
00187   #          differ in magnitude by much.  Gavin has found several
00188   #          situations where this is a problem.
00189   #
00190   if ($l->AdaptParameters($r,$self->{context}->variables->parameters)) {
00191     my $avalues      = $l->{test_adapt};
00192     my $tolerance    = $self->getFlag('tolerance',1E-4);
00193     my $isRelative   = $self->getFlag('tolType','relative') eq 'relative';
00194     my $zeroLevel    = $self->getFlag('zeroLevel',1E-14);
00195     my $zeroLevelTol = $self->getFlag('zeroLevelTol',1E-12);
00196     foreach $i (0..scalar(@{$lvalues})-1) {
00197       my $tol = $tolerance;
00198       my ($lv,$rv,$av) = ($lvalues->[$i]->value,$rvalues->[$i]->value,$avalues->[$i]->value);
00199       if ($isRelative) {
00200     if (abs($lv) <= $zeroLevel) {$tol = $zeroLevelTol}
00201                            else {$tol *= abs($lv)}
00202       }
00203       return $rv <=> $av unless abs($rv - $av) < $tol;
00204     }
00205     return 0;
00206   }
00207 
00208   #
00209   #  Look through the two lists of values to see if they are equal.
00210   #  If not, return the comparison of the first unequal value
00211   #    (not good for < and >, but OK for ==).
00212   #
00213   my $domainError = 0;
00214   foreach $i (0..scalar(@{$lvalues})-1) {
00215     if (ref($lvalues->[$i]) eq 'UNDEF' ^ ref($rvalues->[$i]) eq 'UNDEF') {$domainError = 1; next}
00216     $cmp = $lvalues->[$i] <=> $rvalues->[$i];
00217     return $cmp if $cmp;
00218   }
00219   $l->{domainMismatch} = $domainError;  # return this value
00220 }

00222 #
00223 #  Inherit should make sure the tree is copied
00224 #  (so it's nodes point to the correct equation, for one thing)
00225 #
00226 sub inherit {
00227   my $self = shift; my $tree = $self->{tree};
00228   $self = $self->SUPER::inherit(@_);
00229   $self->{tree} = $tree->copy($self);
00230   $self->{variables} = $tree->getVariables;
00231   return $self;
00232 }

00234 #
00235 #  Don't inherit test values or adapted values, or other temporary items
00236 #
00237 sub noinherit {
00238   my $self = shift;
00239   ($self->SUPER::noinherit(@_),"test_values","test_adapt","tree","string","variables",
00240     "f","stack","ref","tokens","values","space","domainMismatch");
00241 }

00244 #
00245 #  Create the value list from a given set of test points
00246 #
00247 sub createPointValues {
00248   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00249   my $points = shift || $self->{test_points} || $self->createRandomPoints;
00250   my $showError = shift; my $cacheResults = shift;
00251   my @vars   = $context->variables->variables;
00252   my @params = $context->variables->parameters;
00253   my @zeros  = (0) x scalar(@params);
00254   my $f = $self->{f}; $f = $self->{f} = $self->perlFunction(undef,[@vars,@params]) unless $f;
00255   my $checkUndef = scalar(@params) == 0 && (shift || $self->getFlag('checkUndefinedPoints',0));
00256 
00257   my $values = []; my $v;
00258   foreach my $p (@{$points}) {
00259     $v = eval {&$f(@{$p},@zeros)};
00260     if (!defined($v) && !$checkUndef) {
00261       return unless $showError;
00262       Value::Error("Can't evaluate formula on test point (%s)",join(',',@{$p}));
00263     }
00264     if (defined($v)) {
00265       $v = Value::makeValue($v,context=>$context)->with(equation=>$self);
00266       $v->transferFlags("equation");
00267       push @{$values}, $v;
00268     } else {
00269       push @{$values}, $UNDEF;
00270     }
00271   }
00272   if ($cacheResults) {
00273     $self->{test_points} = $points;
00274     $self->{test_values} = $values;
00275   }
00276   return $values;
00277 }
00278 
00279 #
00280 #  Create the adapted value list for the test points
00281 #
00282 sub createAdaptedValues {
00283   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00284   my $points = shift || $self->{test_points} || $self->createRandomPoints;
00285   my $showError = shift;
00286   my @vars   = $context->variables->variables;
00287   my @params = $context->variables->parameters;
00288   my $f = $self->{f}; $f = $self->{f} = $self->perlFunction(undef,[@vars,@params]) unless $f;
00289 
00290   my $values = []; my $v;
00291   my @adapt = @{$self->{parameters}};
00292   foreach my $p (@{$points}) {
00293     $v = eval {&$f(@{$p},@adapt)};
00294     if (!defined($v)) {
00295       return unless $showError;
00296       Value::Error("Can't evaluate formula on test point (%s) with parameters (%s)",
00297            join(',',@{$p}),join(',',@adapt));
00298     }
00299     $v = Value::makeValue($v,context=>$context)->with(equation=>$self);
00300     $v->transferFlags("equation");
00301     push @{$values}, $v;
00302   }
00303   $self->{test_adapt} = $values;
00304 }
00305 
00306 #
00307 #  Create a list of random points, making sure that the function
00308 #  is defined at the given points.  Error if we can't find enough.
00309 #
00310 sub createRandomPoints {
00311   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00312   my ($num_points,$include,$noErrors) = @_; my $cacheResults = !defined($num_points);
00313   $num_points = int($self->getFlag('num_points',5)) unless defined($num_points);
00314   $num_points = 1 if $num_points < 1;
00315 
00316   my @vars   = $context->variables->variables;
00317   my @params = $context->variables->parameters;
00318   my @limits = $self->getVariableLimits(@vars);
00319   my @make   = $self->getVariableTypes(@vars);
00320   my @zeros  = (0) x scalar(@params);
00321   my $f = $self->{f}; $f = $self->{f} = $self->perlFunction(undef,[@vars,@params]) unless $f;
00322   my $seedRandom = $context->flag('random_seed')? 'PGseedRandom' : 'seedRandom';
00323   my $getRandom  = $context->flag('random_seed')? 'PGgetRandom'  : 'getRandom';
00324   my $checkUndef = scalar(@params) == 0 && $self->getFlag('checkUndefinedPoints',0);
00325   my $max_undef  = $self->getFlag('max_undefined',$num_points);
00326 
00327   $self->$seedRandom;
00328   my $points = []; my $values = []; my $num_undef = 0;
00329   if ($include) {
00330     push(@{$points},@{$include});
00331     push(@{$values},@{$self->createPointValues($include,1,$cacheResults,$self->{checkundefinedPoints})});
00332   }
00333   my (@P,@p,$v,$i); my $k = 0;
00334   while (scalar(@{$points}) < $num_points+$num_undef && $k < 10) {
00335     @P = (); $i = 0;
00336     foreach my $limit (@limits) {
00337       @p = (); foreach my $I (@{$limit})
00338         {push @p, $context->Package("Real")->make($context,$self->$getRandom(@{$I}))}
00339       push @P, $make[$i++]->make($context,@p);
00340     }
00341     $v = eval {&$f(@P,@zeros)};
00342     if (!defined($v)) {
00343       if ($checkUndef && $num_undef < $max_undef) {
00344     push @{$points}, [@P];
00345     push @{$values}, $UNDEF;
00346     $num_undef++;
00347       }
00348       $k++;
00349     } else {
00350       $v = Value::makeValue($v,context=>$context)->with(equation=>$self);
00351       $v->transferFlags("equation");
00352       push @{$points}, [@P];
00353       push @{$values}, $v;
00354       $k = 0; # reset count when we find a point
00355     }
00356   }
00357 
00358   if ($k) {
00359     my $error = "Can't generate enough valid points for comparison";
00360     $error .= ':<div style="margin-left:1em">'.($context->{error}{message} || $@).'</div>'
00361       if ($self->getFlag('showTestPointErrors'));
00362     $error =~ s! (in \S+ )?at line \d+.*</div>!</div>!s;
00363     Value::Error($error) unless $noErrors;
00364     return ($points,$values,1);
00365   }
00366 
00367   return ($points,$values) unless $cacheResults;
00368   $self->{test_values} = $values;
00369   $self->{test_points} = $points;
00370 }
00371 
00372 #
00373 #  Get the array of variable limits
00374 #
00375 sub getVariableLimits {
00376   my $self = shift;
00377   my $userlimits = $self->{limits};
00378   if (defined($userlimits)) {
00379     $userlimits = [[[-$userlimits,$userlimits]]] unless ref($userlimits) eq 'ARRAY';
00380     $userlimits = [$userlimits] unless ref($userlimits->[0]) eq 'ARRAY';
00381     $userlimits = [$userlimits] if scalar(@_) == 1 && ref($userlimits->[0][0]) ne 'ARRAY';
00382     foreach my $I (@{$userlimits}) {$I = [$I] unless ref($I->[0]) eq 'ARRAY'};
00383   }
00384   $userlimits = [] unless $userlimits; my @limits;
00385   my $default;  $default = $userlimits->[0][0] if defined($userlimits->[0]);
00386   $default = $default || $self->getFlag('limits',[-2,2]);
00387   my $granularity = $self->getFlag('granularity',1000);
00388   my $resolution = $self->getFlag('resolution');
00389   my $i = 0;
00390   foreach my $x (@_) {
00391     my $def = $self->{context}{variables}{$x};
00392     my $limit = $userlimits->[$i++] || $def->{limits} || [];
00393     $limit = [$limit] if defined($limit->[0]) && ref($limit->[0]) ne 'ARRAY';
00394     push(@{$limit},$limit->[0] || $default) while (scalar(@{$limit}) < $def->{type}{length});
00395     pop(@{$limit}) while (scalar(@{$limit}) > $def->{type}{length});
00396     push @limits, $self->addGranularity($limit,$def,$granularity,$resolution);
00397   }
00398   return @limits;
00399 }
00400 
00401 #
00402 #  Add the granularity to the limit intervals
00403 #
00404 sub addGranularity {
00405   my $self = shift; my $limit = shift; my $def = shift;
00406   my $granularity = shift; my $resolution = shift;
00407   $granularity = $def->{granularity} || $granularity;
00408   $resolution = $def->{resolution} || $resolution;
00409   foreach my $I (@{$limit}) {
00410     my ($a,$b,$n) = @{$I}; $b = -$a unless defined $b;
00411     $I = [$a,$b,($n || $resolution || abs($b-$a)/$granularity)];
00412   }
00413   return $limit;
00414 }

00416 #
00417 #  Get the routines to make the coordinates of the points
00418 #
00419 sub getVariableTypes {
00420   my $self = shift;
00421   my @make;
00422   foreach my $x (@_) {
00423     my $type = $self->{context}{variables}{$x}{type};
00424     if ($type->{name} eq 'Number') {
00425       push @make,($type->{length} == 1)? 'Value::Formula::number': $self->Package("Complex");
00426     } else {
00427       push @make, $self->Package($type->{name});
00428     }
00429   }
00430   return @make;
00431 }

00435 #
00436 sub Value::Formula::number::make {shift; shift; shift->value}

00438 #
00439 #  Find adaptive parameters, if any
00440 #
00441 sub AdaptParameters {
00442   my $l = shift; my $r = shift;
00443   my @params = @_; my $d = scalar(@params); my $D;
00444   return 0 if $d == 0; return 0 unless $l->usesOneOf(@params);
00445   $l->Error("Adaptive parameters can only be used for real-valued formulas")
00446     unless $l->{tree}->isRealNumber;
00447 
00448   #
00449   #  Try up to three times (the random points might not work the first time)
00450   #
00451   foreach my $attempt (1..3) {
00452     #
00453     #  Get coefficient matrix of adaptive parameters
00454     #  and value vector for linear system
00455     #
00456     my ($p,$v) = $l->createRandomPoints($d);
00457     my @P = (0) x $d; my ($f,$F) = ($l->{f},$r->{f});
00458     my @A = (); my @b = ();
00459     foreach my $i (0..$d-1) {
00460       my @a = (); my @p = @{$p->[$i]};
00461       foreach my $j (0..$d-1) {
00462     $P[$j] = 1;
00463     my $y = eval {&$f(@p,@P)};
00464     $l->Error(["Can't evaluate correct answer at adapted point (%s)",join(",",@$p,@P)])
00465            unless defined $y;
00466     push(@a,($y-$v->[$i])->value);
00467     $P[$j] = 0;
00468       }
00469       my $y = eval {&$F(@p,@P)}; return unless defined $y;
00470       push @A, [@a]; push @b, [($y-$v->[$i])->value];
00471     }
00472     #
00473     #  Use MatrixReal1.pm to solve system of linear equations
00474     #
00475     my $M = MatrixReal1->new($d,$d); $M->[0] = \@A;
00476     my $B = MatrixReal1->new($d,1);  $B->[0] = \@b;
00477     ($M,$B) = $M->normalize($B);
00478     $M = $M->decompose_LR;
00479     if (abs($M->det_LR) > 1E-6) {
00480       if (($D,$B,$M) = $M->solve_LR($B)) {
00481         if ($D == 0) {
00482           #
00483           #  Get parameter values and recompute the points using them
00484           #
00485           my @a; my $i = 0; my $max = $l->getFlag('max_adapt',1E8);
00486           foreach my $row (@{$B->[0]}) {
00487             if (abs($row->[0]) > $max) {
00488               $max = Value::makeValue($max); $row->[0] = Value::makeValue($row->[0]);
00489               $l->Error(["Constant of integration is too large: %s\n(maximum allowed is %s)",
00490                  $row->[0]->string,$max->string]) if $params[$i] eq 'C0' or $params[$i] eq 'n00';
00491               $l->Error(["Adaptive constant is too large: %s = %s\n(maximum allowed is %s)",
00492                  $params[$i],$row->[0]->string,$max->string]);
00493             }
00494             push @a, $row->[0]; $i++;
00495           }
00496           my $context = $l->context;
00497           foreach my $i (0..$#a) {$context->{variables}{$params[$i]}{value} = $a[$i]}
00498           $l->{parameters} = [@a];
00499           $l->createAdaptedValues;
00500           return 1;
00501         }
00502       }
00503     }
00504   }
00505   $l->Error("Can't solve for adaptive parameters");
00506 }

00519 #
00520 #  Random number generator  (replaced by Value::WeBWorK.pm)
00521 #
00522 sub seedRandom {srand}
00523 sub getRandom {
00524   my $self = shift;
00525   my ($m,$M,$n) = @_; $n = 1 unless $n;
00526   return $m + $n*int(rand()*(int(($M-$m)/$n)+1));
00527 }

00529 ############################################
00530 #
00531 #  Check if the value of a formula is constant
00532 #    (could use shift->{tree}{isConstant}, but I don't trust it)
00533 #
00534 sub isConstant {
00535   my @vars = (%{shift->{variables}});
00536   return scalar(@vars) == 0;
00537 }
00538 
00539 #
00540 #  Check if the Formula includes one of the named variables
00541 #
00542 sub usesOneOf {
00543   my $self = shift;
00544   foreach my $x (@_) {return 1 if $self->{variables}{$x}}
00545   return 0;
00546 }
